page.title: 06THE BUILDINGS IN WOORE
page.content: Almost all the buildings in Woore are of{brick,}and are not earlier than the nineteenth century. There are a few large houses;{Woore {Manor}in the Square and Bulkeley Hall on the Newcastle Road. {Dorrington {Hall Farm}has some interesting old parts,and{Syllenhurst Farm}is near the site of an old moat. Though they may not be impressive, the ordinary houses, built towards the end of the nineteenth century, usually have some interesting detailed work in the bricklaying. The{"Swan" Hotel}is an old coaching inn, though many alterations have been made. There is a good number of substantial, detached houses in the village, and a development of modern detached houses continues on Westfields and Grove Crescent.
